title: Protocol for designing and preparing gallium particles using cell membrane encapsulation for applications in melanoma cryoablation therapy
procedures:
Step-by-step method details
Step-by-step method details
Step 1: Purification of C8161 cell membrane
Timing: 2–3 h
Preprocess C8161 cells.
Take out C8161 cells (cultured in Step [preparation one[href=https://www.wicell.org#sec1.1]]) which are in the logarithmic growth phase (about 5×106 cells/T75 flask) from 37°C incubator and put them into the biosafety cabinet (Airtech, China).
Remove the cell culture medium in T75 flask, and add 10 mL 1× PBS solution to wash C8161 cells for 2–3 times.
Add 2 mL trypsin and incubate the cells in a 37°C incubator for 2 min.
Then, transfer the cell culture dish to the inverted microscope stage, observe the cell digestion under the microscope until the cells become round and detach in large quantities.
Add 2 mL C8161 complete medium to immediately stop the digestion.
Transfer the cell suspension from the culture dish to a centrifuge tube, and then centrifuge at 300 g for 3–5 min.
After centrifugation, move the centrifuge tube to the biosafety cabinet, then open the lid and remove the supernatant to obtain C8161 cell pellet.
Prepare the purified C8161 cell membrane.
Disperse the C8161 cells pellet (about 1×107 of cells) in 50 mL lysis buffer (composed of 0.25 M sucrose, 1 mM EDTA, 20 mM HEPES, and a cocktail of protease inhibitors).
Sonicate the C8161-lysis buffer suspension in a Cell Disruption Apparatus (JY92-IIN, Ningbo Scientz) for 30 cycles on ice (power: 200 W; 3 s ON, 7 s OFF; 30 cycles).
Centrifuge the mixture at 10,000 g for 25 min (4°C) to keep the supernatant and remove the cell sediment.
Transfer the supernatant into a 26.3 mL Beckman ultracentrifuge tube. And centrifuge at 150,000 g for 35 min (4°C) by an ultracentrifuge (Beckman) to get cell membrane pellet.

Disperse C8161 cell membrane pellet in 1× PBS (1 mL per tube). And then transfer C8161 cell membrane into a new 1.5 mL EP tube (Corning).
Detect the protein concentration of C8161 cell membrane by BCA Protein Assay Kit.
Step 2: Obtain gallium particles (GaPs), cell membrane encapsulated gallium particles (Ga/MPs), and antitumor drug paclitaxel-loaded Ga/MPs (Ga/M/PPs)
Timing: 4–6 h
Prepare chitosan oligosaccharide solution (Table 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#tbl1]).
table:files/protocols_protocol_2135_1.csv
A stock solution with 50 mL should be stored for no longer than 30 days at 25°C.
Weigh 2 g chitosan oligosaccharide (COS) by an analytical balance with the precision of 0.0001 g (METTLER TOLEDO).
Dissolve COS in double distilled H2O (ddH2O) to get COS solution (40 mg/mL COS).
Prepare GaPs. Troubleshooting[href=https://www.wicell.org#troubleshooting] section (problem 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#sec6.1]).
Melt about 4 mL liquid metal-Ga in a 65°C DHG desktop blast drying oven (Shanghai Yiheng).
Note: It is a good idea to use glass beaker to melt Ga since the glass beaker can resist high temperatures and metal corrosion. When Ga is in liquid state, it is confirmed that the Ga has been completely melted.
Preheat COS solution in the 65°C DHG desktop blast drying oven.
Note: Herein, COS solution is preserved in 15 mL centrifuge tube (Corning).
Add 4 g melted Ga metal into 10 mL preheated COS solution by 1 mL pipette (Eppendorf).
Disperse Ga in COS solution at 25°C by ultrasonic cell disruptor (JY92-IIN, Ningbo Scientz) to obtain GaPs solution with a concentration of 0.4 g/mL.
Note: The ultrasonic cell disruptor has a probe which is the key to fabricate GaPs. The parameters of sonication dispersion method are as follows: power: 200 W; 4 s ON, 4 s OFF, 150 cycles.
Centrifuge the above mixture at 150,000 g for 35 min (4°C) and suspended by COS solution to collect GaPs solution.
Assemble Ga/MPs.

Isolate C8161 cell membrane by hypotonic cracking method (with the cells from step 1).
Mix 160 mg GaPs and 1.6 mg C8161 cell membrane with a pipette.
Sonicate the above mixture in the ultrasonic bath (power: 400 W, frequency: 45 kHz) at 25°C for 2 min.
Squeeze the mixture with a 1 mL syringe for 12 times through the 5 μm polycarbonate membrane Avanti mini extruder (Avanti Polar Lipids) to obtain the membrane-coated Ga particles (Ga/MPs).
Assemble Ga/M/PPs. Troubleshooting[href=https://www.wicell.org#troubleshooting] section (problem 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#sec6.3], problem 3[href=https://www.wicell.org#sec6.5]).
Mix 160 mg GaPs and 1.6 mg paclitaxel and 1.6 mg C8161 cell membrane with a pipette.
Sonicate the above mixture in the ultrasonic bath (power: 400 W, frequency: 45 kHz) at 25°C for 2 min.
Squeeze the mixture by a 1 mL syringe through the 5 μm polycarbonate membrane for 12 times to obtain paclitaxel-loaded membrane-coated Ga particles (Ga/M/PPs).
CAUTION: When taking out the glass beaker from the water bath, please wear insulated gloves because the oven temperature oven reaches up to 65°C.
Step 3: Morphological comparison of GaPs and Ga/MPs by TEM and cryo-TEM
Timing: 2 days
The Ga particles are characterized by transmission electron microscope (TEM) at 25°C (Figure 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig1]A) and cryo-TEM at −196°C (Figure 1[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig1]B) to capture their morphological variation in a frozen condition.
imgsrc:https://prod-shared-star-protocols.s3.amazonaws.com/protocols/2135-Fig1.jpg
Figure 1. TEM images and cryo-TEM images of Ga/MPs
(A) TEM image of Ga/MPs at 25°C.
(B) Cryo-TEM image of Ga/MPs under freezing treatment at −196°C. All scale bars: 500 nm.
Prepare the samples of GaPs and Ga/MPs for TEM observation.
Prepare two new 300 mesh carbon-coated copper meshes.
Drop 5 μL GaPs solution and 5 μL Ga/MPs solution prepared in step 2 in 1 mL COS solution separately onto copper meshes.

Incubate the sample for 1 min and then suck out the excess sample solution with clean filter papers.
Drop 5 μL ddH2O onto the copper meshes by a 10 μL pipette to wash the samples for 2 times to remove the COS on top of the copper meshes.
Stain Ga/MPs by 2% v/v uranyl acetate for 2 min.
Dry the copper meshes at 25°C for 2 min.
Observe the samples by transmission electron microscopy (TEM, HT7700, Japan) with the voltage of 80.0 kV.
Prepare the samples of GaPs and Ga/MPs for cryo-TEM observation.
Spread out 5 μL GaPs solution and 5 μL Ga/MPs solution separately onto copper meshes and incubate for 1 min.
Remove the excess sample solution with clean filter paper.
Plunge the copper meshes into liquid ethane for rapid freezing at about −183.3°C.
Note: Ethane is the gaseous state at 25°C. Before the sample is prepared, ethane gas is first blown into a metal cup cooled in liquid nitrogen. The ethane changes from gas state to liquid state in the cup.
Store the prepared samples in liquid nitrogen at about −196°C for cryo-TEM (FEI Tecnai F20 TEM, Netherlands) observation, the parameters of the cryo-TEM are as follows: voltage: 200 kV, magnification: 3k.
CAUTION: Cryogenic liquids such as liquid ethane (boiling point: −183.3°C) and liquid nitrogen (boiling point: −196°C) need to be handled carefully to avoid frostbite.
Critical: Rapid freezing treatment of samples under liquid ethane can promote the amorphous state ice formation without ice crystal, which keeps the frozen sample particles stay in their natural morphology state without any destruction to sample structure and electron diffraction interference during measurement as well.
Step 4: Cell uptake
Timing: 2 days
Digest C8161/B16 cells.

Take out C8161/B16 cells (cultured in Step [preparation one[href=https://www.wicell.org#sec1.1]]) which are in the logarithmic growth phase (about 5 × 106 cells/T75 flask) from 37°C incubator and put them into the biosafety cabinet.
Remove the cell culture medium in T75 flask, and add 10 mL 1× PBS solution to wash C8161/B16 cells for 2–3 times.
Add 2 mL trypsin, incubate in the incubator at 37°C for 2 min.
Transfer the cell culture dish to the inverted microscope stage, and observe the digestion of the cells under a microscope until the cells become round and detach in large quantities.
Add 2 mL cell complete medium to immediately stop the digestion.
Transfer the cell suspension from the culture dish to a centrifuge tube, and then centrifuge at 300 g for 3 min.
After centrifugation, move the centrifuge tube to the biosafety cabinet, then open the lid and remove the supernatant.
Co-culture Ga particles and C8161/B16 cells.
Suspend C8161/B16 cells by 5 mL 1× PBS, and count them with a hemocytometer.
Seed C8161/B16 cells into confocal 8-well dishes (1.0 × 104 cells/dish, Corning) with the corresponding DMEM complete medium.
Culture C8161/B16 cells in the incubator at 37°C for 12 h.
Label Ga/MPs, Ga/M/PPs with 100 μM 1,10-dioctadecyl-3,3,30,30-tetramethylindo-carbocyanine perchlorate (DiI) in 1× PBS at 25°C for 5 min. Ga/MPs solution: DiI= 10:1, v/v. Ga/M/PPs solution: DiI= 10:1, v/v.
Transfer the mixture into a 0.5 mL concentration tube (50 kDa), and centrifuge at 3000 g for 5 min (20°C) to remove the free Dil and get Dil-Ga/MPs and Dil-Ga/M/PPs.
Add GaPs, Dil-Ga/MPs and Dil-Ga/M/PPs into confocal 8-well dish to co-incubate with C8161/B16 cells at 37°C for 4 h to prepare the co-incubated C8161/B16 cells.
Observe the co-incubation results of cells by confocal microscope.

Remove the cell culture medium in the confocal dish, and wash the co-incubated C8161/B16 cells with 200 μL 1× PBS for 2–3 times to remove free GaPs, Dil-Ga/MPs and Dil-Ga/M/PPs.
Fix the co-incubated C8161/B16 cells with 200 μL of 4% v/v of paraformaldehyde (Beyotime) for 10 min.
Stain the nucleus of the co-incubated C8161/B16 cells with 200 μL DAPI solution for 10 min.
Rinse the cells with 200 μL 1× PBS for 2–3 times.
Observe the cells using 40× objective by the confocal laser scanning microscope (ZEISS).
Step 5: Temperature-dependent deformation and endosomal escape
Timing: 2 days
Treat the co-incubated cells at different temperature.
Digest C8161 cells as per step 9 in step 4.
Suspend the cells by 5 mL 1× PBS, and count them with a hemocytometer.
Seed C8161 cells into confocal 8-well dishes (1.0×104 cells/dish) with DMEM complete medium.
Culture C8161 cells in the incubator at 37°C for 12 h.
Label Ga/MPs with 10 μM DiI in 1× PBS at 25°C for 5 min.
Transfer the mixture into a 0.5 mL concentration tube (50 kDa), and centrifuge at 3000 g for 5 min to remove the free Dil.
Add DiI-Ga/MPs into the confocal 8-well dish to co-incubate with C8161 cells at 37°C for 4 h.
Place C8161 cells (defined as control group) at 25°C for 5 min. And place C8161 cells (defined as cryo group) at −80°C for 5 min.
Incubate all the cells at 37°C for 10 min to rewarm.
Aspirate cell culture medium with Dil-Ga/MPs, and wash C8161 cells with 200 μL 1× PBS for 2–3 times.
Observe the endosomal escape results of the co-incubated cells.
Stain endosomes with Lysotracker Deep Red in DMEM medium for 20–30 min.
Rinse C8161 cells by 200 μL 1× PBS for 2–3 times.

Observe the co-localization of Ga/MPs and endosomes with a 63× oil immersion objective by a confocal laser scanning microscope.
Step 6: In vitro cytotoxicity
Timing: 3 days
Seed cells into 96-well plate and do the frozen treatment.
Digest C8161/B16/HaCaT cells as per step 9 in step 4 respectively.
Suspend C8161/B16/HaCaT cells by 5 mL 1× PBS, and count C8161/B16/HaCaT cells by a hemocytometer.
Seed C8161/B16/HaCaT cells into 96-well plate (4.0 × 103 cells/ well) with the corresponding DMEM complete medium.
Culture C8161/B16/HaCaT cells in 37°C incubator for 12 h.
Add 1× PBS, GaPs (400 ng/μL), Ga/MPs (400 ng/μL), Ga/M/PPs (400 ng/μL) into 96-well plate to co-incubate with C8161/B16/HaCaT cells at 37°C for 24 h.
Place C8161/B16/HaCaT cells (defined as control group) at 25°C for 5 min. And place C8161/B16/HaCaT cells (defined as cryo group) at −80°C for 5 min.
Note: Here, both control group and cryo groups contains 12 samples: PBS-C8161, PBS-B16, PBS-HaCaT, GaPs-C8161, GaPs-B16, GaPs-HaCaT, Ga/MPs-C8161, Ga/MPs-B16, Ga/MPs-HaCaT, Ga/M/PPs-C8161, Ga/M/PPs-B16, Ga/M/PPs-HaCaT.
Incubate all the cells at 37°C for 10 min to rewarm.
Measure and calculate cell viability.
Remove cell culture medium, and wash them with 100 μL 1× PBS for 2–3 times to clean 1× PBS, GaPs, Ga/MPs or Ga/M/PPs in the culture medium.
Add 10 μL CCK-8 (Cell Counting Kit-8, Dojindo) reagent into each well of 96-well plate.
After 1 h incubation, the multifunctional enzyme marker (Thermo Scientific) is applied to the optical density (OD) with the excitation wavelength of 450 nm.
Note: The cell viability is calculated by the formula (ODeg-ODb)/(ODcg-ODb), where ODeg means the OD of cells cultured by GaPs, Ga/MPs, Ga/M/PPs with and without freezing treatments, ODcg means the OD of cells cultured by 1× PBS, and ODb means the OD of wells filled with only CCK-8 solution.
Step 7: In vivo antitumor cryotherapy

Timing: 11 weeks
C8161 tumor-bearing mice are applied for in vivo cryotherapy with three Ga particles (GaPs, Ga/MPs and Ga/M/PPs) injected directly into tumor sites to achieve high performance of tumor ablation under freezing treatment.
Inject the pre-prepared three Ga solutions (GaPs, Ga/MPs and Ga/M/PPs, obtained from step 2) separately into tumor site 24 h ahead of in vivo cryo-treatments.
Prepare 200 μL 1× PBS solution, 200 μL GaPs solution, 200 μL Ga/MPs solution, and 200 μL Ga/M/PPs solution.
Note: The concentrations of the three Ga solutions are all 0.4 g/mL. 1× PBS and the three Ga solutions are separately mixed by a pipette before injecting into mouse tumor sites.
56 tumor-bearing mice prepared in Step [preparation two[href=https://www.wicell.org#sec1.2]] are randomly divided into 8 groups and each group have 7 mice.
Note: Here, 1- PBS group means inject 100 μL 1× PBS per mouse into the tumor tissue site, 2- PBS+Cryo group means inject 100 μL 1× PBS per mouse into the tumor tissue site with tumor cryoablation, 3-GaPs group means inject 100 μL GaPs solution per mouse into the tumor tissue site, 4-GaPs+Cryo group means inject 100 μL GaPs solution per mouse into the tumor tissue site with tumor cryoablation, 5-Ga/MPs group means inject 100 μL Ga/MPs solution per mouse into the tumor tissue site, 6-Ga/MPs group means inject 100 μL Ga/MPs solution per mouse into the tumor tissue site with tumor cryoablation, 7-Ga/M/PPs group means inject 100 μL Ga/M/PPs solution per mouse into the tumor tissue site, 8-Ga/M/PPs group means inject 100 μL Ga/M/PPs solution per mouse into the tumor tissue site with tumor cryoablation.
In-vivo cryo-treatments with cryoablation system. Troubleshooting[href=https://www.wicell.org#troubleshooting] section (problem 4[href=https://www.wicell.org#sec6.7], problem 5[href=https://www.wicell.org#sec6.9]).
Intraperitoneally inject 2.5% v/v Avertin solution for mice with dosage of 100 μL/10 g.

Directly insert cryoprobe of HYG-II cryoablation system into tumor tissue (Figure 2[href=https://www.wicell.org#fig2]).
imgsrc:https://prod-shared-star-protocols.s3.amazonaws.com/protocols/2135-Fig2.jpg
Figure 2. The schematic of cryoablation treatment for tumor-bearing mouse
In order to perform cryoablation, cryoprobe is inserted into tumor site and cryosurgery system controls the ablation temperature by alternating cold medium liquid nitrogen and heat medium ethanol delivery for cooling and heating.
Treat tumor-bearing mice for 4 min for each time and twice totally with the interval of 7 days.
Monitor body temperature of mice by infrared camera and thermocouple during treatment process.
Measure body weight of mice.
Measure tumor length and width of mice by the Vernier caliper, and accordingly to calculate the tumor volumes.
Observe tumor growth by in vivo small animal optical imaging device (IVIS Spectrum, PerkinElmer, America) with Em: 540 nm, Ex: 500 nm, exposure time: 2 s.
Critical: In the animal experiment, the Ga based drug dosage is 10 mg per mouse (500 mg/kg). Many studies have reported the safe dosage of metal Ga in living bodies, and 700 mg/kg has been identified as its maximum tolerated dose (MTD). (Yan et al., 2018[href=https://www.wicell.org#bib8]). In this experiment, the Ga dosage in mice have met the requirement of MTD.
